intro: Seymeriopsis bissei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf seymeriopsis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Seymeriopsis bissei is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
